abstract: For Occupy Wall Street organizers and social media experts, protest actions speak louder, especially on sites like Facebook and Twitter.
snippet: For Occupy Wall Street organizers and social media experts, protest actions speak louder, especially on sites like Facebook and Twitter.
lead_paragraph: Social media has played a vital role in the Occupy Wall Street movement since it began as a Twitter experiment in July, when the anticonsumerism magazine Adbusters posted a suggestion for a Sept. 17 march in Lower Manhattan. And over the last two months, protesters used cellphones and social sites like Twitter, Facebook and YouTube to spread their message around the world.

headline.main: Protesters Look for Ways to Feed the Web
headline.print_headline: Protesters Look for Ways to Feed the Web
